bayes2stage 0.0.0.9000

Package index

Data Generation

Simulate longitudinal data for two-stage designs

generate_data()
Generate correlated random intercept / slope longitudinal data
generate_data_schild_2019_supp()
Generate correlated random intercept / slope longitudinal data to test two-stage design methods. In the form of Schildcrout (2019) supplement

Sampling Designs

Select subjects for stage 2 measurement

srs_design()
Set x to missing based on an SRS design
ods_design()
Set x to missing based on an ODS design
bds_design()
Set x to missing based on an BDS design

Model Fitting

Fit Bayesian models with imputation

fit_stan_model()
Fit a Bayesian two-stage model using Stan
fit_model()
Fit a Bayesian two-stage model using NIMBLE
fit_acml_ods()
Fit ACML model for outcome-dependent sampling

MCMC Diagnostics

Summarize and visualize MCMC output

mcmc_summary()
Extract MCMC summary statistics
mcmc_trace()
Plot MCMC trace plots
mcmc_forest()
Create a forest plot of MCMC output

Utilities

Helper functions

cantor_seed()
Generate a unique seed from two indices using Cantor pairing
format_data_mcmc()
Format the simulated data for Stan / NIMBLE
set_missing()
Given selected subjects, set X to missing for those not selected
plot_data()
Plot simulated data
check_cols()
Check for required columns in a data frame

ACML Internal Functions

Internal functions for ascertainment-corrected maximum likelihood

ACi1q()
Ascertainment correction piece for univariate sampling
ACi2q()
Ascertainment correction piece for bivariate sampling
logACi1q()
Log of the Ascertainment correction for univariate sampling
logACi1q.score2()
Gradient of the log of the ascertainment correction piece for sampling based on univariate Q_i
logACi2q()
Log of the Ascertainment correction piece for bivariate sampling
logACi2q.score2()
Gradient of the log of the ascertainment correction piece for sampling based on bivariate Q_i.
li.lme()
Calculate a subject-specific contribution to a log-likelihood for longitudinal normal data
li.lme.score2()
Subject specific contribution to the lme model score (also returns marginal Vi=Cov(Y|X))
vi.calc()
Calculate V_i = Z_i D t(Z_i) + sig_e^2 I_(n_i)
acml.lmem2()
Fitting function: ACML or WL for a linear mixed effects model (random intercept and slope)
CreateSubjectData()
Create a list of subject-specific data
LogLikeC2()
Calculate the conditional likelihood for the univariate and bivariate sampling cases across all subjects (Keep.liC=FALSE) or the subject specific contributions to the conditional likelihood along with the log-transformed ascertainment correction for multiple imputation (Keep.liC=TRUE).
LogLikeC.Score2()
Calculate the gradient of the conditional likelihood for the univariate and bivariate sampling cases across all subjects (CheeseCalc=FALSE) or the cheese part of the sandwich estimator if CheeseCalc=TRUE.
LogLikeCAndScore2()
Calculate the ascertainment corrected log likelihood and score
LogLikeiC2()
Calculate the ss contributions to the conditional likelihood for the univariate and bivariate sampling cases.
